section.heading: Requirements for international banking corporation activities.

para.text: An international banking corporation may transact a banking business, or maintain in the District of Columbia an office for carrying on such business, or any part thereof, if the corporation has:
Been authorized by its charter to carry on a banking business and has complied with the laws of the jurisdiction in which it is chartered;
Furnished to the Department such proof as to the nature and character of its business and as to its financial condition as the Department may require;
Filed with the Department a certified copy of any information required to be supplied to the District of Columbia by a foreign corporation under § 29-101.99; and
An international banking corporation may engage in representational and other activities in the District of Columbia, other than those specified in § 26-635, only as authorized in § 26-636.
Any person who establishes or maintains an office or transacts business in the District of Columbia in violation of this section shall be subject to the penalties imposed by § 26-103(g).
